Key Arguments: The submission argues that there is widespread corruption in government and public administration in Australia, which undermines trust in any agency being given the power to decide what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
It suggests that giving a single agency or authority the power to determine misinformation or disinformation could lead to further corruption and lack of accountability.
The submission emphasizes the importance of freedom of speech and the right of individuals to access and evaluate information independently.
It argues that individuals should have the right to make their own decisions about what information to trust, without interference from government or other authorities.
Main Themes: Corruption and lack of trust in government
Freedom of speech and individual rights
Skepticism towards centralized control over information
Notable Quotes: No government agency or authority should be given complete discretion to make the decision as to whether they consider presented information to be misinformation or disinformation.
Freedom of speech through all and any media/s that an individual chooses to use to express themselves should be an inherent right of every citizen.
Do not allow this travesty against freedom of speech to go ahead.
